channel.title: post on Young-ISA
channel.description: Recent content in post on Young-ISA

item.title: 2nd Young-ISA Meeting
item.description: The 2nd Young-ISA meeting is dedicated to Communication and Reproducibility in Statistics.

item.title: On the privilege of turning our world into data
item.description: Dr Rohan Alexander from University of Toronto will speak on the origins of Data Science, and especially the contributions of Irish statisticians on the field.

item.title: Estimating energy allocation between somatic and gonadic growth
item.description: Dr Hideyasu Shimadzu from Loughborough University, UK, will speak on the nature of the challenges associated with quantifying the growth patterns and energy allocation strategies of living organisms and the interactions with broader biological communities in which they reside.

item.title: Assessing the impact of deprivation and ethnicity on COVID burden in England
item.description: Dr. Tullia Padellini from Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics, School of Public Health, Imperial College London will speak on how the ethnically diverse and deprived communities have been differentially affected by the COVID-19 pandemic in the UK by assessing three different metrics of COVID-19 burden (test positivity, prevalence and vaccination rates).

item.title: Characterisation of the probability and information entropy of a process with an increasing sample space of different functional forms, with applications to (1) the Broad Money Supply and (2) Hyperinflation
item.description: Laurence Francis Lacey will speak on the application of different functional forms of the expansion of the sample space with time in expansion of the broad money supply of US$ over the period 2001 to 2019.

item.title: Condition based maintenance - a guideline for choosing between repair and replacement
item.description: Dr. Elham Mosayebi Omshi will speak on an adapted maintenance modeling framework for modeling the maintenance cost of a system.

item.title: Condition based maintenance - a guideline for choosing between repair and replacement
item.description: Dr. Elham Mosayebi Omshi will speak on an adapted maintenance modeling framework for modeling the maintenance cost of a system.

item.title: Efficient Conversion Probability Estimator for Display Advertising
item.description: Dr. Abdollah Safari from faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences, University of British Colombia will speak on methods to estimate the conversion probability of an advertisement to quantify the value of an ad.

item.title: Introductory data science, a fresh look
item.description: Dr. Mine Ã‡etinkaya-Rundel from the School of Mathematics, University of Edinburgh; Department of Statistical Science, Duke University; and RStudio will speak on a fresh approach to teaching data science at the introductory level and will introduce the design philosophy behind the curriculum as well as provide directions in assessment in this online teaching era.

item.title: An introduction to the tidymodels package
item.description: Bruna Wundervald from the School of Mathematics, National University of Ireland, Maynooth will introduce tidymodels packages, and how they can be used for the pre-processing of data, and training and validation of machine learning models.

item.title: Clustering Big Data with Mixed Features
item.description: Joshua Tobin from the School of Computer Science & Statistics, Trinity College Dublin, will introduce a new clustering method for large mixed attribute datasets which adapts and extends the popular peak-finding technique. The algorithm presented is competent at deciding the correct number of clusters and executes with subquadratic complexity.

item.title: Global Short-Term Forecasting of Covid-19 Cases
item.description: Dr. Thiago de Paula Oliveira from the Roslin Institute, University of Edinburgh will speak on a new modelling framework of COVID-19 to forecast the number of cases, study the effects of covariates (such as lockdown policies), and generate forecasts for smaller regions within countries and up to six days ahead.

item.title: Young-ISA Twitter Poster Conference (#YISAPoster2020)
item.description: This Twitter Poster Conference aims to provide an opportunity for Statisticians and Data Scientists around the world to meet online, share their research and engage in scientific discussion

item.title: Inaugural Young-ISA Meeting
item.description: This inaugural event will gather together early career statisticians from across Ireland for a series of talks on career development in academia and industry
